qas.question: Who refused a German-Soviet peace plan?
Why was the west creating a war?
Who provides rhetoric points for the Soviet propaganda?
Who refused a German-Soviet war plan?
Who accepted a German-Soviet peace plan?
Why was the east creating a war?
Why was the west creating peace?
Who provides rhetoric points against the Soviet propaganda?

context: When a joint German–Soviet peace initiative was rejected by <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Britain and France<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> on 28 September 1939, Soviet foreign policy became critical of the Allies and more pro-German in turn. During the fifth session of the Supreme Soviet on 31 October 1939 <a2_0><b7_0>Molotov<b7_0/><a2_0/> analysed the international situation thus giving the direction for Communist propaganda. According to Molotov Germany had a legitimate interest in regaining its position as a great power and the Allies had started an aggressive war in order <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>to maintain the Versailles system<b6_0/><b5_0/>.
